p: The epigenome, an intersection between the environment and the genome, has been implicated in the regulation of gene expression and cellular functions, and plays an essential role in the delineation of phenotypes and their preservation [ 21]. Novel information has contributed to an improved understanding of the role of epigenetic modifications in defining the molecular basis of IBD [ 123, 124]. Regarding IBD, the first epigenetic modifications associated with disease pathogenesis were based on DNA methylation studies [ 125].
